actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow Federal income tax returns to be inspected by a common tax auditing agent utilized by the States.

summary.text: Common Tax Audit Act - Permits any State, under the Internal Revenue Code, to designate the tax authorities of another State, or any commission or association of States, to conduct a tax audit of any business subject to the tax jurisdiction of one or more of the designating States. Permits such audit to include Federal income tax returns, the books and records of account of any taxpayer or any business to determine whether or not the State has jurisdiction to impose a tax liability.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow Federal income tax returns to be inspected by a common tax auditing agent utilized by the States.
